title: PHPparse_str()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPparse_str()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content: Example Parse a query string into variables: "; echo $age; ?> Definition and Usage The parse_str() function parses a query string into variables. Note: If the array parameter is not set, variables set by this function will overwrite existing variables of the same name. Note: The magic_quotes_gpc setting in the php.ini file affects the output of this function. If enabled, the variables are converted by addslashes() before parsed by parse_str(). Syntax parse_str( string,array ) Parameter Values Parameter Description string Required. Specifies the string to parse array Optional (Required from PHP 7.2). Specifies the name of an array to store the variables. This parameter indicates that the variables will be stored in an array. Technical Details Return Value: No value is returned PHP Version: 4+ Changelog: PHP 7.2.0 - The array parameter is required. PHP 4.0.3 - Added the array parameter. More Examples Example Store the variables in an array: ★ +1
